title: Ticket #1549: New Classads should not support octal integer literals
description:
New Classads supports octal integer literals, indicated by a leading zero. Old classads did not support this. We have no way to print out octal literals. More importantly, this is bound to surprise some user who accidentally enters a classad value with a leading zero, perhaps for formatting reasons. New classads also supports hex literals, but this is less of a problem, as no one is going to accidentally type in a leading 0x, and expect a decimal value.

Let's drop support for octal, sorry pdp-11 lovers.
remarks:
2010-Aug-02 14:28:01 by jfrey:
The first step is to disable parsing of octal and hex integers when in old ClassAd emulation mode. That's a simple change.

2010-Aug-02 14:48:40 by jfrey:
Octal and hex integers are no longer recognized when new ClassAds are in old ClassAd emulation mode (i.e. _useOldClassAdSemantics is set to true). Change pushed to master for 7.5.4.
